title: Ward Hopping
body:
Why is Yi not being able to Ward Hop but Lee Sin and Jax are able to?

Why is Jax able to Hop on Ally units as well?

replies.body:
How would Yi ward hop?

What spell does he have that works functionally like Lee's leap and Jax's leap?

> [{quoted}](name=TyrekGoldenspear,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qMbqOMy3,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-03-14T20:18:02.509+0000)

Yi got Alpha Strike that requires him a target. Same goes for Lee sin and Jax that got targeted ability that allows then to jump to ally or enemy

So why are they able to do that But Yi is not being able to

For this to work you would need to code it so that Yi can Alpha to allied units as well.

So what's stopping him from doing it uncontrollably?

For example, say you have an enemy in a minion wave and you alpha strike. He doesn't have much minions, but you want to poke him with an Alpha.

So you Alpha Strike to your minion to "bridge" to him, but you just fly across your minion wave at random and maybe hit an enemy minion.

This just adds a whole other mess of interactions with Yi's Alpha and makes it possible to dodge or otherwise ignore a Yi's alpha if you're in his wave based on RNG.

That AOE damage comes from other spells.

{{champion:64}} His ward hop is single target. It's the E (I think) that he usually hits right after the leap that does the AOE.

{{champion:24}} His leap is also single target. It's his stun that is AOE and does damage. His leap itself has nothing to do with it.

So what you are really asking for is for Yi to have AOE damage of any kind, which his entire kit lacks save for Alpha's several-units-in-rapid-succession kind of AOE.

[Specific Champion Subclass](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/3A5uuBw7-champion-subclass-list) / [Class and Subclass](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/gameplay/dev-blog-classes-subclasses)

Does he? He fits pretty well into the skirmisher description from your first link.


"Unlike Assassins, Skirmishers aim to shred through any nearby enemy that approaches. Because Skirmishers lack high-end burst damage or reliable ways of closing in on high-priority targets, they are instead armed with situationally powerful defensive tools to survive in the fray, along with extreme sustained damage to cut down even the most durable targets"

Yi:
-lacks high end burst damage
-lacks a reliable way of closing in high priority targets (he has to burn one of his defensive tools and its fairly short range compared to Vi's Q>R which they use as their example of a diver.
-Situationally powerful defensive tools fits his Q and W very well. Q is only as powerful as the ability you're dodging, and W is only really reliable if they have burned their CC.
-Extreme sustained damage also fits Yi very well between Wuju Style, his passive, and the extensions on his ultimate 


In any case, as I said earlier they're trying to phase out wardhops, not put more in the game. I think yi does need some help, but with his current kit it is really hard to balance it for both low and high elo games. He really needs some kit changes to be balance able

> Yasuo got billion dashes for instance and can cc his opponents to escape

Yasuo needs a target for his dashes, so he can't use that for an escape unless you're fighting in minions or near monsters. So if wants to use it then you know exactly where he is going. Additionally, If you pick fights away from those, he has no way to escape at all, unlike Yi who has massive movespeed on demand. If Yasuo is using his CC to escape, he isn't killing you and as Yi, you can dodge it with Q, which also prevents him from using his ultimate.

You're also ignoring the fact that Riot is trying to take out ward hops, not put them in. 
-Kat's rework took hers away
-Braum was released without the ability to wardhop even though his dash is used on friendly targets.
